metadata.title: CVE-2020-15653 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An iframe sandbox element with the allow-popups flag could be bypassed whenusing noopener links. This could have led to security issues for websitesrelying on sandbox configurations that allowed popups and hosted arbitrarycontent. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.1, Firefox < 79, andThunderbird < 78.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15653` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
